This week, Lewis returned for its final series (for the third time) and it was brilliant as ever, says Katy Sandalls

The Timelord moved onto his second two-parter of the series this week with Under the Lake. Katy Sandalls reviews

TV Review: Fear the Walking Dead - Series 1 Episode 6: 'The Good Man'

The series finale of Fear the Walking Dead is a heart-pounding, action-packed and zombie-filled spectacle and is truly the show at its best, says Liam Dooley

TV Review: Doctor Who - Series 9 Episode 2: 'The Witch's Familiar'

Davros and the Doctor get some of their finest scenes in the thrilling second episode of Doctor Who's ninth (or thirty-fifth) series, says Rhys Thompson

The penultimate episode of Fear the Walking Dead explores the outside world after the outbreak in greater detail than ever before. Liam Dooley reviews.

Review: Solace

The terrible quality of this film about a psychic doctor hunting down a serial killer is something that you'd wish you could have foretold before watching it, says Lauren McNeilage

By James Bithell

Liam Dooley and Rhys Thompson preview autumn's big and small screen offerings

Review: Everest

The most hostile environment on Earth makes the perfect setting for a thoroughly engaging disaster movie, says Tom Parkes

TV Review: Fear the Walking Dead - Series 1 Episode 4: 'Not Fade Away'

The military's response to the outbreak of the zombie apocalypse has the potential for some great storylines, but unfortunately it is not well utilised in this week's episode, says Liam Dooley.

The ninth series of Doctor Who starts with the return of an old friend and some old enemies. Katy Sandalls reviews

Molly Mcelwee reviews Bake Off as the remaining hopefuls are faced with a brand new challenge - Historical Week

Review: 45 Years

By James Bithell

Andrew Haigh's film of an ordinary couple celebrating an anniversary is 'pure poetry in the domestic space', says Laura Hancock

TV Review: This is England '90 - Episode 1

This first episode does not quite live up to what we expect from the This is England franchise, but it isn't entirely unredeemable either, says Simran Virdee.

Review: The Visit

Unpretentious and darkly funny, The Visit marks a return to form for M Night Shyamalan, says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: Fear the Walking Dead - Series 1 Episode 3: 'The Dog'

An increased sense of impending danger is what makes this the most thrilling episode of the series so far, says Liam Dooley

Review: Legend

Tom Hardy is becoming such a legendary actor that for this gangster film they chose to cast him twice, says Simran Virdee

TV Review: An Inspector Calls

Irritating music and script changes blunt the impact of the BBC's stylish adaptation of J.B. Priestley's classic play, says Rhys Thompson

TV Review: The Great British Bake Off - Series 6 Episode 6

As Bake Off continues, the bakers attempt Pastry Week - with mixed results. Leah Huws reviews

TV Review: Lady Chatterley's Lover

Prettily shot and well-acted, but in robbing the story of so much of its physicality, this adaptation also robs it of its soul, says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: The Great British Bake Off - Series 6 Episode 5

Rhys Thompson reviews The Great British Bake Off's 'alternatives' week

TV Review: Fear the Walking Dead - Series 1 Episode 2: 'So Close, Yet So Far'

The dead are beginning to rise and Los Angeles is none the wiser, says Liam Dooley

TV Review: The Great British Bake Off - Series 6 Episode 4

Leah Huws reviews The Great British Bake Off as the remaining bakers are challenged by Dessert Week

Review: Man From U.N.C.L.E.

Despite a weak plot, Guy Ritchie's cinematic reboot of the '60s TV classic is an enjoyable espionage caper, says Laura Hancock

Review: Sinister 2

This sequel lacks the atmosphere of its predecessor, but makes up for it with great performances and sympathetic characters, says Lauren McNeilage
